children.text: Document API Requirements
An LRS has a State API with endpoint "base IRI"+"/activities/state"
An LRS has an Activities API with endpoint "base IRI" + /activities"
An LRS has an Activity Profile API with endpoint "base IRI"+"/activities/profile"
An LRS has an Agents API with endpoint "base IRI" + /agents"
An LRS has an Agent Profile API with endpoint "base IRI"+"/agents/profile"
An LRS has an About API with endpoint "base IRI"+"/about"
An LRS will accept a POST request to the State API
An LRS will accept a POST request to the Activity Profile API
An LRS will accept a POST request to the Agent Profile API
An LRS's State API, upon receiving a POST request for a document not currently in the LRS, treats it as a PUT request and store a new document
An LRS's State API, rejects a POST request if the document is found and either document's type is not "application/json" with error code 400 Bad Request
A Document Merge overwrites any duplicate Objects from the previous document with the new document.
A Document Merge only performs overwrites at one level deep, although the entire object is replaced.
An LRS's State API performs a Document Merge if a document is found and both it and the document in the POST request have type "application/json"
An LRS's Activity Profile API, upon receiving a POST request for a document not currently in the LRS, treats it as a PUT request and store a new document
An LRS's Activity Profile API, rejects a POST request if the document is found and either document's type is not "application/json" with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Activity Profile API performs a Document Merge if a document is found and both it and the document in the POST request have type "application/json"
An LRS's Agent Profile API, upon receiving a POST request for a document not currently in the LRS, treats it as a PUT request and store a new document
An LRS's Agent Profile API, rejects a POST request if the document is found and either document's type is not "application/json" with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Agent Profile API performs a Document Merge if a document is found and both it and the document in the POST request have type "application/json"
An LRS's State API accepts PUT requests
An LRS's State API rejects a PUT request without "activityId" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's State API rejects a PUT request without "agent" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's State API rejects a PUT request with "agent" as a parameter if it is not in JSON format with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's State API can process a PUT request with "registration" as a parameter
An LRS's State API rejects a PUT request without "stateId" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's State API upon processing a successful PUT request returns code 204 No Content
An LRS's State API accepts POST requests
An LRS's State API rejects a POST request without "activityId" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's State API rejects a POST request without "agent" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's State API can process a POST request with "registration" as a parameter
An LRS's State API rejects a POST request without "stateId" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's State API upon processing a successful POST request returns code 204 No Content
An LRS's State API accepts GET requests
An LRS's State API rejects a GET request without "activityId" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's State API rejects a GET request without "agent" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's State API can process a GET request with "registration" as a parameter
An LRS's State API can process a GET request with "stateId" as a parameter
An LRS's State API can process a GET request with "since" as a parameter
An LRS's State API rejects a GET request with "since" as a parameter if it is not a "TimeStamp", with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's State API upon processing a successful GET request with a valid "stateId" as a parameter returns the document satisfying the requirements of the GET and code 200 OK
An LRS's State API upon processing a successful GET request without "stateId" as a parameter returns an array of ids of state data documents satisfying the requirements of the GET and code 200 OK
An LRS's returned array of ids from a successful GET request all refer to documents stored after the TimeStamp in the "since" parameter of the GET request
An LRS's State API accepts DELETE requests
An LRS's State API rejects a DELETE request without "activityId" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's State API rejects a DELETE request without "agent" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's State API can process a DELETE request with "registration" as a parameter
An LRS's State API can process a DELETE request with "stateId" as a parameter
An LRS's State API upon processing a successful DELETE request with a valid "stateId" as a parameter deletes the document satisfying the requirements of the DELETE and returns code 204 No Content
An LRS's State API upon processing a successful DELETE request without "stateId" as a parameter deletes documents satisfying the requirements of the DELETE and code 204 No Content
An LRS's Activities API accepts GET requests
An LRS's Activities API rejects a GET request without "activityId" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Activities API rejects a GET request with "activityId" as a parameter if it is not type "String" with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Activities API upon processing a successful GET request returns the complete Activity Object
An LRS's Activity Profile API accepts PUT requests
An LRS's Activity Profile API rejects a PUT request without "activityId" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Activity Profile API rejects a PUT request without "profileId" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Activity Profile API upon processing a successful PUT request returns code 204 No Content
An LRS's Activity Profile API accepts POST requests
An LRS's Activity Profile API rejects a POST request without "activityId" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Activity Profile API rejects a POST request without "profileId" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Activity Profile API upon processing a successful POST request returns code 204 No Content
An LRS's Activity Profile API accepts DELETE requests
An LRS's Activity Profile API rejects a DELETE request without "activityId" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Activity Profile API rejects a DELETE request without "profileId" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Activity Profile API upon processing a successful DELETE request deletes the associated profile and returns code 204 No Content
An LRS's Activity Profile API accepts GET requests
An LRS's Activity Profile API rejects a GET request without "activityId" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Activity Profile API can process a GET request with "since" as a parameter
An LRS's Activity Profile API upon processing a successful GET request with a valid "profileId" as a parameter returns the document satisfying the requirements of the GET and code 200 OK

An LRS's Activity Profile API upon processing a successful GET request without "profileId" as a parameter returns an array of ids of activity profile documents satisfying the requirements of the GET and code 200 OK
An LRS's returned array of ids from a successful GET request all refer to documents stored after the TimeStamp in the "since" parameter of the GET request if such a parameter was present
An LRS's Agents API accepts GET requests
An LRS's Agents API rejects a GET request without "agent" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Agent Profile API accepts PUT requests
An LRS's Agent Profile API rejects a PUT request without "agent" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Agent Profile API rejects a PUT request without "profileId" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Agent Profile API upon processing a successful PUT request returns code 204 No Content
An LRS's Agent Profile API accepts POST requests
An LRS's Agent Profile API rejects a POST request without "agent" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Agent Profile API rejects a POST request with "agent" as a parameter if it is not an Agent Object with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Agent Profile API rejects a POST request without "profileId" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Agent Profile API upon processing a successful POST request returns code 204 No Content
An LRS's Agent Profile API accepts DELETE requests
An LRS's Agent Profile API rejects a DELETE request without "agent" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Agent Profile API rejects a DELETE request without "profileId" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Agent Profile API upon processing a successful DELETE request deletes the associated profile and returns code 204 No Content
An LRS's Agent Profile API accepts GET requests
An LRS's Agent Profile API rejects a GET request without "agent" as a parameter with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Agent Profile API can process a GET request with "since" as a parameter
An LRS's Agent Profile API upon processing a successful GET request with a valid "profileId" as a parameter returns the document satisfying the requirements of the GET and code 200 OK

An LRS's Agent Profile API upon processing a successful GET request without "profileId" as a parameter returns an array of ids of agent profile documents satisfying the requirements of the GET and code 200 OK
An LRS's returned array of ids from a successful GET request all refer to documents stored after the TimeStamp in the "since" parameter of the GET request if such a parameter was present
An LRS's About API accepts GET requests
An LRS's About API upon processing a successful GET request returns a version property and code 200 OK
An LRS's About API's version property is an array of strings
An LRS's About API's version property contains at least one string of "1.0.1"
An LRS's About API's version property can only have values of ".9", ".95", "1.0", "1.0.0", or ""1.0." + X" with
An LRS's About API upon processing a successful GET request can return an Extension with code 200 OK
Any LRS API that accepts a POST request can accept a POST request with a single query string parameter named "method" on that request
An LRS must parse the body of a Cross Origin Request and construct a new Request from it with the type of Request being the same as the value of the "method" parameter
An LRS will map form parameters from the body of the Cross Origin Request to the similarly named HTTP Headers in the new Request
An LRS rejects a new Request in the same way for violating rules of this document as it would a normal Request **Implicit**
An LRS will reject any request sending content which does not have a form parameter with the name of "content"
An LRS will reject a new Request with a form parameter named "content" if "content" is found to be binary data with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS will reject a Cross Origin Request which attempts to send attachment data with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS accepts HEAD requests
A Person Object is an Object
A Person Object's "objectType" property is a String and is "Person"
A Person Object's "name" property is an Array of Strings
A Person Object's "mbox" property is an Array of IRIs
A Person Object's "mbox" entries have the form "mailto:emailaddress"
A Person Object's "mbox_sha1sum" property is an Array of Strings
A Person Object's "openid" property is an Array of Strings
A Person Object's "account" property is an Array of Account Objects
An LRS's Activity Profile API rejects a PUT request with "agent" as a parameter if it is not in JSON format with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Agent API rejects a GET request with "agent" as a parameter if it is a valid (in structure) Agent with error code 400 Bad Request
An LRS's Agent API upon processing a successful GET request returns a Person Object if the "agent" parameter can be found in the LRS and code 200 OK
An LRS will reject a Cross Origin Request or new Request which contains any extra information with error code 400 Bad Request **Implicit**
An LRS will treat the content of the form parameter named "content" as a UTF-8 String
An LRS cannot reject a POST request to the State API based on the contents of the name/value pairs of the document
Should accept POST to State with document [object Object]
Should accept POST to State with document 1
Should accept POST to State with document true
An LRS cannot reject a POST request to the Activity Profile API based on the contents of the name/value pairs of the document
Should accept POST to Activity profile with document [object Object]
Should accept POST to Activity profile with document 1
Should accept POST to Activity profile with document true
An LRS cannot reject a POST request to the Agent Profile API based on the -s of the name/value pairs of the document

Should accept POST to Agent profile with document 1
Should accept POST to Agent profile with document true

should succeed HEAD about with no body
should succeed HEAD activities with no body
should succeed HEAD activities profile with no body
should succeed HEAD activities state with no body
should succeed HEAD agents with no body
should succeed HEAD agents profile with no body
should succeed HEAD statements with no body

Should reject PUT with "agent" with type 1
Should reject PUT with "agent" with type true
Should reject PUT with "agent" with type not Agent
Should reject PUT with "agent" with type [object Object]
An LRS must support HTTP/1.1 entity tags (ETags) to implement optimistic concurrency control when handling APIs where PUT may overwrite existing data
When responding to a GET request to State resource, include an ETag HTTP header in the response
When responding to a GET request to Agent Profile resource, include an ETag HTTP header in the response
When responding to a GET request to Activities Profile resource, include an ETag HTTP header in the response
When returning an ETag header, the value should be calculated as a SHA1 hexadecimal value
When responding to a GET Request the Etag header must be enclosed in quotes
When responding to a PUT request, must handle the If-Match header as described in RFC 2616, HTTP/1.1 if it contains an ETag
When responding to a PUT request, handle the If-None-Match header as described in RFC 2616, HTTP/1.1 if it contains “*”
If Header precondition in PUT Requests for RFC2616 fail
Return HTTP 412 (Precondition Failed)
Do not modify the resource
If put request is received without either header for a resource that already exists
Return 409 conflict
Return plaintext body explaining the situation
Do not modify the resource
An LRS populates the "authority" property if it is not provided in the Statement, based on header information with the Agent corresponding to the user (contained within the header)
should populate authority
A Voiding Statement cannot Target another Voiding Statement
should fail when "StatementRef" points to a voided statement
should fail when "StatementRef" points to a voiding statement
An LRS returns a ContextActivity in an array, even if only a single ContextActivity is returned
should return array for statement context "parent"  when single ContextActivity is passed
should return array for statement context "grouping"  when single ContextActivity is passed
should return array for statement context "category"  when single ContextActivity is passed
should return array for statement context "other"  when single ContextActivity is passed
should return array for statement substatement context "parent"  when single ContextActivity is passed
should return array for statement substatement context "grouping"  when single ContextActivity is passed
should return array for statement substatement context "category"  when single ContextActivity is passed
should return array for statement substatement context "other"  when single ContextActivity is passed
An LRS rejects with error code 400 Bad Request, a Request which uses Attachments and does not have a "Content-Type" header with value "application/json" or "multipart/mixed"
should succeed when attachment uses "fileUrl" and request content-type is "application/json"
should fail when attachment uses "fileUrl" and request content-type is "multipart/form-data"
should succeed when attachment is raw data and request content-type is "multipart/mixed"
should fail when attachment is raw data and request content-type is "multipart/form-data"

An LRS rejects with error code 400 Bad Request, a PUT or POST Request which uses Attachments, has a "Content-Type" header with value "application/json", and has a discrepancy in the number of Attachments vs. the number of fileURL members
should fail when passing statement attachments and missing attachment"s binary

An LRS rejects with error code 400 Bad Request, a PUT or POST Request which uses Attachments, has a "Content Type" header with value "multipart/mixed", and does not have a body header named "Content-Type" with value "multipart/mixed"
should fail when attachment is raw data and first part content type is not "application/json"

An LRS rejects with error code 400 Bad Request, a PUT or POST Request which uses Attachments, has a "Content Type" header with value "multipart/mixed", and does not have a body header named "boundary"
should fail if boundary not provided in body
A Boundary is defined as the value of the body header named "boundary"
should fail if boundary not provided in header

An LRS rejects with error code 400 Bad Request, a PUT or POST Request which uses Attachments, has a "Content Type" header with value "multipart/mixed", and does not have a Boundary before each "Content-Type" header
should fail if boundary not provided in body

An LRS rejects with error code 400 Bad Request, a PUT or POST Request which uses Attachments, has a "Content Type" header with value "multipart/mixed", and does not the first document part with a "Content-Type" header with a value of "application/json"
should fail when attachment is raw data and first part content type is not "application/json"

An LRS rejects with error code 400 Bad Request, a PUT or POST Request which uses Attachments, has a "Content Type" header with value "multipart/mixed", and does not have all of the Statements in the first document part
should fail when statements separated into multiple parts

An LRS rejects with error code 400 Bad Request, a PUT or POST Request which uses Attachments, has a "Content Type" header with value "multipart/mixed", and for any part except the first does not have a Header named "X-Experience-API-Hash" with a value of one of those found in a "sha2" property of a Statement in the first part of this document
should fail when attachments missing header "X-Experience-API-Hash"
should fail when attachments header "X-Experience-API-Hash" does not match "sha2"
An LRS rejects with error code 400 Bad Request, a Request which does not use a "X-Experience-API-Version" header name to any API except the About API
should pass when GET without header "X-Experience-API-Version"
should fail when statement GET without header "X-Experience-API-Version"
should fail when statement POST without header "X-Experience-API-Version"
should fail when statement PUT without header "X-Experience-API-Version"
An LRS MUST set the X-Experience-API-Version header to the latest patch version
should respond with header "version" set to "1.0.3"
An LRS will not modify Statements based on a "version" before "1.0.1"
should not convert newer version format to prior version format
An LRS rejects with error code 400 Bad Request any request to an API which uses a parameter with differing case
should fail on PUT statement when not using "statementId"
should fail on GET statement when not using "statementId"
should fail on GET statement when not using "voidedStatementId"
should fail on GET statement when not using "agent"
should fail on GET statement when not using "verb"

should fail on GET statement when not using "format"

should fail on GET statement when not using "ascending"

should fail with statement "DELETE"
should fail with activities "DELETE"
should fail with activities "POST"
should fail with activities "PUT"
should fail with agents "DELETE"
should fail with agents "POST"
should fail with agents "PUT"
An LRS does not process any batch of Statements in which one or more Statements is rejected and if necessary, restores the LRS to the state in which it was before the batch began processing
should not persist any statements on a single failure
An LRS has a Statement API with endpoint "base IRI"+"/statements"
should allow "/statements" POST
should allow "/statements" PUT
should allow "/statements" GET
An LRS's Statement API accepts PUT requests
should persist statement using "PUT"
An LRS's Statement API accepts PUT requests only if it contains a "statementId" parameter
should persist statement using "statementId" parameter
should fail without using "statementId" parameter
An LRS's Statement API accepts PUT requests only if the "statementId" parameter is a String
should fail statement using "statementId" parameter as boolean
should fail statement using "statementId" parameter as object
An LRS cannot modify a Statement, state, or Object in the event it receives a Statement with statementID equal to a Statement in the LRS already.
should not update statement with matching "statementId" on POST
should not update statement with matching "statementId" on PUT
An LRS's Statement API upon processing a successful PUT request returns code 204 No Content
should persist statement and return status 204
An LRS's Statement API rejects with error code 409 Conflict any Statement with the "statementID" parameter equal to a Statement in the LRS already **Implicit**
should return 409 or 204 when statement ID already exists on POST
should return 409 or 204 when statement ID already exists on PUT
An LRS's Statement API accepts POST requests
should persist statement using "POST"
The LRS will NOT reject a GET request which returns an empty "statements" property
should return empty array list
An LRS's Statement API upon processing a successful POST request returns code 200 OK and all Statement UUIDs within the POST **Implicit**
should persist statement using "POST" and return array of IDs
A "more" property is an IRL
should return "more" property as an IRL
The "more" property is an empty string if the entire results of the original GET request have been returned
should return empty "more" property when all statements returned
If not empty, the "more" property's IRL refers to a specific container object corresponding to the next page of results from the orignal GET request
should return "more" which refers to next page of results
A Voided Statement is defined as a Statement that is not a Voiding Statement and is the Target of a Voiding Statement within the LRS
should return a voided statement when using GET "voidedStatementId"
An LRS's Statement API, upon processing a successful GET request, can only return a Voided Statement if that Statement is specified in the voidedStatementId parameter of that request
should not return a voided statement if using GET "statementId"
LRS's Statement API accepts GET requests
should return using GET
An LRS's Statement API can process a GET request with "statementId" as a parameter
should process using GET with "statementId"
An LRS's Statement API can process a GET request with "voidedStatementId" as a parameter
should process using GET with "voidedStatementId"
An LRS's Statement API rejects with error code 400 a GET request with both "statementId" and anything other than "attachments" or "format" as parameters
should fail when using "statementId" with "agent"
should fail when using "statementId" with "verb"
should fail when using "statementId" with "activity"
should fail when using "statementId" with "registration"
should fail when using "statementId" with "related_activities"
should fail when using "statementId" with "related_agents"
should fail when using "statementId" with "since"
should fail when using "statementId" with "until"
should fail when using "statementId" with "limit"
should fail when using "statementId" with "ascending"
should pass when using "statementId" with "format"
should pass when using "statementId" with "attachments"

Miscellaneous Requirements
All Objects are well-created JSON Objects (Nature of binding) **Implicit**
All Strings are encoded and interpreted as UTF-8
A "more" property's referenced container object follows the same rules as the original GET request, originating with a single "statements" property and a single "more" property
An LRS's Statement API rejects with Error Code 400 Bad Request any DELETE request
A POST request is defined as a "pure" POST, as opposed to a GET taking on the form of a POST

An LRS rejects with error code 400 Bad Request, a GET Request which uses Attachments, has a "Content-Type" header with value "application/json", and has the "attachments" filter attribute set to "true"
An LRS's Statement API will reject a GET request having the "attachment" parameter set to "false" and the Content-Type field in the header set to anything but "application/json"

An LRS rejects with error code 400 Bad Request, a PUT or POST Request which uses Attachments, has a "Content Type" header with value "multipart/mixed", and does not have a body header named "MIME-Version" with a value of "1.0" or greater

An LRS rejects with error code 400 Bad Request, a PUT or POST Request which uses Attachments, has a "Content Type" header with value "multipart/mixed", and for any part except the first does not have a Header named "Content-Transfer-Encoding" with a value of "binary"
An LRS's Statement API will reject a GET request having the "attachment" parameter set to "true" if it does not follow the rest of the attachment rules
An LRS's Statement API will reject a GET request having the "attachment" parameter set to "false" if it includes attachment raw data
An LRS sends a header response with "X-Experience-API-Version" as the name and "1.0.3" as the value
An LRS rejects a Statement due to size if the Statement exceeds the size limit the LRS is configured to with error code 413 Request Entity Too Large
An LRS rejects a Statement due to network/server issues with an error code of 500 Internal Server Error
An LRS's Statement API, upon receiving a Get request, had a field in the header with name "Content-Type" ***Assumed?***
The Statements within the "statements" property will correspond to the filtering criterion sent in with the GET request **Implicit**
A "statements" property which is too large for a single page will create a container for each additional page
An LRS's Statement API, upon processing a successful GET request, will return a single "more" property
A "more" property IRL is accessible for at least 24 hours after being returned
A Document Merge is defined by the merging of an existing document at an endpoint with a document received in a POST request.
A Document Merge de-serializes all Objects represented by each document before making other changes.
A Document Merge re-serializes all Objects to finalize a single document
In 1.0.3, the IRI requires a scheme, but does not in 1.0.2, thus we only test type String in this version
NOTE: **There is no requirement here that the LRS reacts to the "since" parameter in the case of a GET request with valid "stateId" - this is intentional**
A Cross Origin Request is defined as this POST request as described in the previous requirement (definition)
An LRS accepts HEAD requests without Content-Length headers
An Extension's structure is that of "key"/"value" pairs
An LRS rejects with error code 400 Bad Request, a Request whose "authority" is a Group and consists of non-O-Auth Agents
An LRS rejects a Statement of bad authorization (either authentication needed or failed credentials) with error code 401 Unauthorized
An LRS rejects with error code 400 Bad Request any request to an API which uses a parameter not recognized by the LRS
A GET request is defined as either a GET request or a POST request containing a GET request
An LRS makes no modifications to stored data for any rejected request
An LRS generates the "id" property of a Statement if none is provided
An LRS doesn't make any adjustments to incoming Statements that are not specifically mentioned in this section
statement values should be the same
LRS must validate and store statement signatures if they are provided
Signed statement with "RS256"
LRS must reject with 400 a signed statement with malformed signature - bad contentType
LRS must reject with 400 a signed statement with malformed signature - bad algorithm
LRS must reject with 400 a signed statement with malformed signature - bad JSON serialization of statement
